conclusion: Mass of rod a, m_a = 0.3 kg
The constant force applied on rod a, F = 2 N
Gravitational force on rod a, F_ga = 1.5 N
Induced current in rod a, I_a = 0.5 A
Magnetic force on rod a, F_Ba = 0.05 N
Net force on rod a, F_net = 0.45 N
Acceleration of rod a, a_a = 1.5 m/s^2
Mass of rod b, m_b = 0.1 kg
Induced current in rod b, I_b = B L v_b / 2R
Magnetic force on rod b, F_Bb = B I_b L
Gravitational force on rod b, F_gb = 0.5 N
Net force on rod b, F_net = F_Bb - F_gb
Equation for magnetic force on rod b, F_Bb = B^2 L^2 v_b / 2R
Balance net force on rod b, B^2 L^2 v_b / 2R = m_b g sin theta
Substitute values to find v_b, v_b = 10 m/s
The speed magnitude of rod b is 10 m/s
